label: Description
value: Panel of white taffeta embroidered in a pattern of flowers in multicolored silks. Vase form in the center with plume-like ornaments in metallic thread. Edged with bobbin lace and metallic trim.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered on taffeta weave; bobbin lace

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Miss Adele Kneeland through Mrs. Philip Ainsworth Means

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Paper leaf gilded and painted in watercolor, showing three medallions (two of statuary and trees, third of three ladies and three cupids in landscape), border of painted red bows. Carved ivory sticks.

label: Physical description
value: Paper leaf gilded and painted in watercolor, ivory sticks

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (open): 27.9 x 48.3 cm (11 x 19 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Miss Adele Kneeland through Mrs. Philip Ainsworth Means

label: Description
value: Pleated fan with leaf of parchment painted on both sides. An allegorical wedding scene in classical imagery. By the altar of Hymen (the Greek god of marriage), the couple are tethered to cupid's chariot. At left, a river god. Sticks of carved and pierced ivory, showing a man and woman, inlaid with mother-of-pearl thumb guard, and metal rivet head.

label: Physical description
value: Painted parchment leaf, carved and pierced ivory sticks inlaid with mother-of-pearl, mother-of-pearl thumb guard, metal rivet

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1939: Miss Adele Kneeland collection; 1939: acquired by the Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Miss Adele Kneeland through Mrs. Philip Ainsworth Means

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace, peasant style

value: Bequest of Miss Adele Kneeland through Mrs. Philip Ainsworth Means

label: Description
value: Lace edging with rounded scallops. Design shows two rows of tape arranged in curves and deep scallops formed by short braids and the typical "wheat grain" ornament.

value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace, continuous braid-like

value: Bequest of Miss Adele Kneeland through Mrs. Philip Ainsworth Means

label: Description
value: A toile “Paul et Virginie” by Huet. Brown printed on a white ground showing two women with babies, a man approaching two children, a shipwreck, two men in a rowboat, and a boy and girl on shore. Many plant forms as background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1939: Henry O. Milliken collection; 1939: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Design of cap crown with premade tape forming loops and filled in with needle work stitches. The tape loops are held together with needle stitches and the cap crown is edged on three sides with bobbin lace.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: lace of early premade tape with needle work fillings, edged on three sides with bobbin lace

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George Nichols from the collection of her mother, Mrs. J.P. Morgan

label: Description
value: Design of a pre-made continuous tape pattern forming two candelabra motifs, placed alternately, on a mesh ground. One edge is pointed. Piece has been sewed together by joining ends. The tape pattern is not placed on the mesh ground, the net is added to the edges of the tape pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace, pre-made continuous tape with net added
